name: Midisticks
overview:
Midisticks Ltd is developing an innovative (patented) electronic percussion instrument, namely Midisticks.

Midisticks are normal drumsticks with electronic sensors attached. The drumsticks can be trained to detect and identify a number of surface materials. The identified materials are then mapped to industry standard MIDI (Musical Instrument Digital Interface) messages.

The final effect is that drumming on different surfaces (Tabletop, mouse mat, pad of paper, seat cushion etcâ€¦) can produce different sounds via MIDI messages associated with those surfaces i.e. your surroundings could become a simple drum set.

The MIDI messages, themselves, are generated by a separate device (for example PC/Mac), which could also accept external MIDI messages (for example from a MIDI bass drum pedal and Hi Hat Controller pedal).

The sticks are velocity sensitive - meaning that the more delicately a material is played, the quieter the associated sound produced (i.e. the velocity parameter associated with the MIDI message issued by the system varies depending on how firmly a surface is struck).

Unlike some other similar products, the sticksâ€™ sensitivity together with their bounce and response following a strike allow for quite realistic drumming effects and techniques (e.g. subtle buzzes and rolls).
